text: Acridocarpus (from Gr. Akris, a locust and carpos, a fruit, alluding to the winged fruit) is a genus of plant in family Malpighiaceae. They are native to Arabia and tropical and subtropical Africa, with one species in New Caledonia. ==Species== There are some 30 species, which include: * Acridocarpus austrocaledonicus * Acridocarpus chevalieri * Acridocarpus monodii Arènes & P.Jaeger ex Birnbaum & J.Florence * Acridocarpus orientalis (Jebel Hafeet, UAE / Oman) * Acridocarpus natalitius Adr. & Juss. * Acridocarpus socotranus Oliv. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Malpighiaceae Category:Malpighiaceae genera Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Acridocarpus
